name: Libraries
body:
There are:
* static libraries (*.a)
* shared libraries (*.so)

A static library is essentialy a set of object files.

_How to create an object file?_
```c++
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int foo()
{
  cout << "I'm foo()" << endl;
}
```
```
g++ -c tools.cpp
```

> the -c option says not to run the linker 
(man page citation)

Result: tools.o

_How to create a static library?_
```
ar -cq libtools.a tools.o
```

And check the results (list the content of a specified archive):
```
$ ar -t libtools.a
tools.o
```

_How to use a library?_
```c++
#include <iostream>
#include "tools.h"

using namespace std;

int main()
{
  cout << "I'm calling foo()..." << endl;
  foo();
  cout << "I'm back!" << endl;
}
```
```
g++ -L . main.cpp -ltools
```
How to find all static libraries in your system?
```
find / -name *.a 2>/dev/null
```
